subject: Re: overriding a method executed in the constructor: dont't work.
msgSnippet: ...  ...  Odd - works for me: c: test javac -classpath junit.jar CommandTest.java c: test java -cp .;junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner CommandTest
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "tusc72" <tusc72@y...> wrote:
> Hi, I have a class that loads data from a file in it's constructor.
> To easy test this class, I delegate the loading to a method,
> initData(). It's works well, until I want to play with params:

<snip>

> C:\>javac -classpath junit.jar CommandTest.java
>
> C:\>java -cp .;junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner CommandTest
> ......F
> Time: 0
> There was 1 failure:
> 1)

<snip>

Odd - works for me:

c:\test>javac -classpath junit.jar CommandTest.java

c:\test>java -cp .;junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner CommandTest
......
Time: 0.016

OK (6 tests)

Which JDK are you using?

Jon
